item.title: Grand Theft Auto 6 Gets Special Label, According to Industry Analyst
item.description:
The co-founder of Devolver Digital has posited that the highly-anticipated Grand Theft Auto 6 is befitting of the "AAAAA" label. For decades, the term "AAA" has been used as shorthand to describe the most ambitious games with huge development and marketing budgets behind them, but it appears that the unprecedented hype around GTA 6 could warrant the addition of two more As to the game's scope descriptor.

AAA games usually come from big publishers like Sony, Microsoft, EA, Ubisoft, and of course, Take Two. More recently, Ubisoft even toyed with the AAAA label to market its 2024 live-service title Skull and Bones and justify a whopping $70 price tag, but that effort went down in ridicule after the game posted a disappointing commercial performance. Against this backdrop, Rockstar Games' much-awaited next entry in the Grand Theft Auto series has been singled out as something else entirely.

Devolver Digital Co-Founder Reckons GTA 6 is a AAAAA Game

Speaking to IGN, Devolver Digital co-founder Nigel Lowrie recently declared that GTA 6 could be considered the first real AAAAA game . He argued that no other series in gaming matches GTA 's sheer scope, scale, and cultural weight. "There are AAA games and then there's AAAA games, and I'd argue that Grand Theft Auto is potentially the AAAAA game," said Lowrie. There is undoubtedly stratospheric anticipation going into GTA 6 's launch in May 2026, and Lowrie believes that the game is "just bigger than anything else" and demands great attention.

GTA 6 itself does look much more technically advanced than the usual AAA release, with both the game's trailers having shown off extremely beautiful visuals, highly realistic animations, sprawling landscapes, and more. In fact, GTA 6 is rumored to have racked up a $1 billion budget in the eight-odd years it's been in development, which would likely cement it as the most expensive game to make in history. Despite that, analyst projections estimate that GTA 6 might generate more than $10 billion in revenue, with as much as $7.6 billion accrued in the game's first two months on the market.

There are AAA games and then there's AAAA games, and I'd argue that Grand Theft Auto is potentially the AAAAA game; it's just bigger than anything else both in the scope and scale of the game and the kind of cultural impact that it has and the attention it demands.

Lowrie's comments definitely feed into the fairly-valid existing notion that many in the industry hold: GTA 6 will be a cultural phenomenon at launch that'll end up overshadowing everything else around it, so it comes as no surprise that other studios are actively looking to get out of the Rockstar juggernaut's blast radius. Interestingly, Devolver Digital previously joked about releasing a game alongside GTA 6 on May 26, 2026, but Lowrie now says that he's not willing to "risk the livelihood" of a development team and the "future of the game they've worked on for five years," which is the prudent decision to make.

item.title: Where To Find Pilgrim Shawls In Silksong (Garb Of The Pilgrims Quest)
item.description:
There are many things to do and items to collect in Hollow Knight: Silksong . Many of these items are spread across the large areas of Pharloom. Some are always available for players to access, while others are hidden, waiting to reward players' curiosity when they find them. Additionally, there are still some tasks and quests to obtain specific items, such as the Garb of the Pilgrims quest in Silksong .

Garb Of The Pilgrims Quest Guide In Silksong

After beating the Bell Beast in Silksong , you can head back to the Bone Bottom safe area and interact with the Wishwall to find four new quests.

One of these missions is the Garb of the Pilgrims quest in HK Silksong , where you have to collect 12 Pilgrim Shawls . It’s an item that drops from Pilgrim enemies after they fall. Those types of enemies are all over the map, so you can complete the quest naturally while progressing Silksong ’s main story quest, or farm Pilgrim Shawls to get the reward early in Silksong .

After collecting all 12 Pilgrim Shawls, return to the Wishwall and turn in the Pilgrim Shawls to complete the Garb of the Pilgrims quest in Silksong , and get the Rosary Necklace reward. It’s an item that can be broken to obtain a large quantity of Rosaries, 120 Rosaries to be exact.

Best Pilgrim Shawl Locations In Silksong

To collect the 12 Pilgrim Shawls in Silksong , head to Mosshome , since most of its enemies are Pilgrim enemies. There’s a bench right next to Mosshome’s entrance, which helps you reload the area quickly. That’s one of the main reasons why Mosshome is one of the best places on Silksong ’s map to farm Pilgrim Shawls alongside some Rosaries.

These Pilgrim enemies are different from the regular bugs you encounter in the game; they’re aggressive and can overwhelm you if you don’t handle them carefully. The melee ones tend to jump around, applying pressure, while the ranged ones shoot from a distance and step back. After gaining more skills and tools, like the Drifter's Cloak, which you get after completing the Flexile Spines quest in Silksong , fighting these enemies becomes much easier.

item.title: Best Triple-A JRPGs Ever, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Monster Hunter Stories 2: Wings of Ruin showcases gripping turn-based combat within the Monster Hunter universe.
  • Super Mario RPG is a visually enhanced remake that modernizes the classic RPG while maintaining its original charm.
  • Tales of Arise by Bandai Namco Studios offers an award-winning narrative, branching stories, and captivating JRPG combat.

Over the years, there have been countless Japanese role-playing games created by a wide variety of companies with both big and small teams of people. While there have been countless incredible JRPGs made by indie or double-A companies, those that are looking for the titles that have had the most amount of money invested in them that have been spent incredibly well should look no further than these triple-A titles.

With games like Final Fantasy being one of the most well-known franchises of AAA JRPGs, players may be surprised to hear that triple-A JRPGs are few and far between, with these games in particular being some of the best, ranked by how much they have been enjoyed by their audiences. The entries within this article have been picked incredibly strictly to only include Triple-A titles. This means that games such as Persona have not been included, as, although they are high-quality titles, they do not contain as large a budget as commonly discussed triple-A games.

8 Monster Hunter Stories 2: Wings of Ruin

An Epic Adventure In A Spin-Off Title

Monster Hunter Stories 2: Wings of Ruin
8 /10
Released
July 9, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ for Everyone 10+: Crude Humor, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language
Developer(s)
Capcom
Platform(s)
PC, Switch
Powered by

Unsurprisingly, the Monster Hunter franchise is heavily considered a triple-A title. However, while some players may feel this only focuses on the more action-packed main titles of the series, Capcom has been sure to invest not only a large budget but also an immense amount of detail and effort into their spin-off Monster Hunter games, such as Monster Hunter Stories 2: Wings of Ruin .

In this adorable JRPG, players become a rider and form bonds with various monsters in the Monster Hunter world. Within the incredible story of Monster Hunter Stories 2 , players will get involved in some of the best turn-based combat to test the limits of their monsters.

7 Super Mario RPG (2023)

Repair The Star Road Once More In An Incredible Remake

Super Mario RPG
8.7 /10
Released
November 17, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E For Everyone Due To Mild Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
Nintendo
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch
Powered by

Some of the greatest AAA JRPGs are the remakes of classic titles such as Super Mario RPG . Many players have looked forward to this title being remade, especially those who couldn't enjoy the original due to it releasing on the Super Nintendo Entertainment System.

Due to this game being promoted by Nintendo itself and using the iconic mascot of the console, Mario, it's no surprise to see the budget and attention that was put behind Super Mario RPG . Combining the world of Super Mario with typical yet engaging JRPG combat that now has better graphics proves that Super Mario RPG is certainly an AAA JRPG players should consider on the Switch.

6 Yakuza: Like A Dragon

Yakuza With Incredibly Dynamic RPG Combat

Yakuza: Like A Dragon
9.5 /10
Released
November 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Alcohol
Developer(s)
Ryu Ga Gotoku Studio
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Previously to Yakuza: Like a Dragon , the games in the franchise didn't use turn-based JRPG combat but instead real-time brawling. While some players may believe that this would be Yakuza's downfall, many players of the franchise found Yakuza: Like a Dragon to be a welcome change to the franchise, as well as being a great experience elsewhere in the game.

With an entirely new protagonist to control, alongside the change of genre, Yakuza: Like a Dragon was a perfect re-imagination of a well-loved series of games. It should be highlighted that, compared to other triple-A games mentioned, Yakuza: Like a Dragon did have a much tighter budget. However, due to its high quality of gameplay, alongside story, voice acting, and animations, Like a Dragon proves itself to be worthy of being called a triple-A game.

5 Tales Of Arise

One Of The Best Modern JRPGs Created

Tales of Arise
10 /10
7.5 /10
Released
September 10, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Alcohol Reference, Blood, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Developer(s)
Bandai Namco Studios
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
OpenCritic Rating
Mighty
Powered by

Until recent years, the majority of AAA JRPGs that were considered some of the best were classic games that many players may feel nostalgic about when starting again. Since then, there have been plenty of AA JRPGs, but not many prominent AAA ones. However, the highly respected Bandai Namco Studios managed to break into the JRPG genre with an entirely new AAA game known as Tales of Arise .

With two entirely different branching stories depending on which protagonist the player chooses, it's no surprise that Tales of Arise received The Best RPG Game of 2021 at the Game Awards. This is only one way in which Tales of Arise proves itself, as the characters and combat within this phenomenal JRPG are also something for players to get lost in. All this wouldn't be possible without the time, money, and effort that Bandai Namco put into the game to create one of the greatest modern AAA JRPGs.

4 Kingdom Hearts 2

A JRPG Filled With Much-Loved Disney Characters

6 Images
6 Images
Kingdom Hearts 2
Action RPG
Hack and Slash
Systems
Released
March 28, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Mild Blood, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Developer(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
PS2, PS3, PS4, PC
Powered by

As previously seen, some of the best triple-A JRPGs are those that are classic games, with some of those that were released in the early 2000s being some of the best. While remakes like Super Mario RPG are perfect for modern audiences, classics like Kingdom Hearts 2 are JRPGs that haven't become outdated even as games have moved on.

The Kingdom Hearts franchise as a whole by Square Enix can be considered AAA games, though out of all the JRPGs that were released as part of the Kingdom Hearts series, Kingdom Hearts 2 is by far one of the greatest, with players praising the story of this role-playing game, as well as being one that players should surely replay even countless years later.

3 Pokemon HeartGold & SoulSilver

Pokemon Continues To Rule JRPGs As A Franchise

6 Images
6 Images
Pokemon HeartGold and SoulSilver
10.0 /10
Released
March 14, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Developer(s)
Game Freak
Platform(s)
Nintendo DS
Powered by

Nintendo continues to make some of the most well-known AAA games in recent years, with another popular franchise being Pokemon . Due to the turn-based nature of the combat between these adorable pocket monsters, Pokemon is another that can be considered a JRPG, with almost any game in the franchise being able to score a spot as one of the best triple-A JRPGs to be created.

Since not every single Pokemon game can be listed, Pokemon HeartGold & SoulSilver have been deemed by a large majority of the Pokemon franchise to be one of the best to be released. As remakes of the original Pokemon Gold & Silver , these games brought the second generation of Pokemon into the fourth generation, with the game's abundance of content and incredible quality.

2 Final Fantasy 6

The Most Loved Game In The Final Fantasy Franchise

Final Fantasy 6
13
9.1 /10
Released
October 11, 1994

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Fantasy Violence, Partial Nudity
Developer(s)
Square Enix, Square
Platform(s)
SNES, Android, iOS, Nintendo Game Boy Advance, PC, PS1, PS4, Switch
Powered by

Another prominent franchise of JRPGs that has proven to be not only astounding for the genre, but also impressive AAA games is the Final Fantasy series. Even after countless years since the first game was released, Final Fantasy has remained popular with a large fan base of players who look forward to not only new games but also remakes of classic ones.

Once again, every single Final Fantasy game cannot be listed, and, therefore, Final Fantasy 6 is the triple-A JRPG that deserves to be highlighted as one of the greatest in the franchise. Players can enjoy Final Fantasy 6 on PC or Mobile with reworked 2D graphics and improved audio, while still feeling nostalgic about the original and why this is one of the greatest JRPGs to exist.

1 Dragon Quest 11 S: Echoes Of An Elusive Age

A Modern Take On A Classic With A Lot Invested In It

Dragon Quest XI S: Echoes of An Elusive Age - Definitive Edition
RPG
Systems
Released
September 27, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Crude Humor, Simulated Gambling, Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol, Mild Blood, Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
Square Enix
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, Xbox One, PC, PlayStation 4
Powered by

Square Enix has proven itself to be one of the best companies for creating JRPGs, with many of their games having large budgets, teams, and effort put into each title. This has led them to make countless high-end franchises, with one of the best JRPGs in recent history for triple-A games being a new title for the classic Dragon Quest series. Dragon Quest 11 S: Echoes of an Elusive Age was critically acclaimed during its release for successfully holding the torch that was the previous games in the Dragon Quest franchise.

With an entirely new story, detailed graphics, and another phenomenal soundtrack, there is a lot to enjoy in Dragon Quest 11 . With Definitive versions also available for this Square Enix title, it is obvious to see the amount of work and attention that has been given to the JRPG, Dragon Quest , and why it is by far one of the greatest of all time, especially when considering AAA games.

item.title: Should You Free Grindle in Silksong?
item.description:
After you defeat the Bell Beast in Silksong , players who continue to the right of the boss arena will eventually run into a building that Hornet can enter. This building, on the far top right of The Marrow zone, is home to Grindle, a prisoner who asks Hornet to break him out of jail.

Grindle says he has been imprisoned for "a little light thievery", and it's up to you to decide whether to free the prisoner in Silksong or leave him in his cell. This guide details what happens if you free the prisoner in Silksong and explains why you might want to break Grindle out of his cell – and why you might want to wait until the community has more information.

What Happens If You Free The Prisoner?

There are a handful of known consequences for freeing the prisoner in Silksong , but most of them seem to be positive . Though he was imprisoned for life for "a little light thievery" (according to his own words), if you free Grindle, you'll get a handy Tool and turn him into a unique vendor.

  • The Straight Pin is a Tool that Hornet can equip that allows her to launch a small projectile forward, dealing her normal damage to enemies hit.
    • Go into Grindle's cell and jump into the cell above to find this on the ground.

  • If you let him free and exhaust his dialogue, then leave and return to the area, Grindle will become a kind of vendor. Instead of accepting your Rosaries for goods, though, Grindle will offer secrets and information .
    • At first, this costs 10 Rosaries, but every time you buy a secret, the price goes up.

You must leave the prison, sit on a bench, then return to the prison to trigger Grindle to move out of his cell and offer his information services. Resting at a bench updates your Map, resets enemy positions and progresses the world state, for example, if you have met the requirements to make an NPC move to another location.

Should You Free Grindle In Silksong?

Because of the lack of information about the Grindle's development in the late game, i t would appear that there is nothing wrong with helping the prisoner in Silksong . You get access to a useful offensive Tool and the ability to purchase hints about future areas, bosses, and other information about your journey.

These are both useful for Hornet, so unless the community discovers some nefarious result of this decision, it would appear that players should break the prisoner out of jail .

In the early game, these are the only consequences for freeing the prisoner in the Marrow. If he betrays Hornet or other consequences arise because you chose to free Grindle, this guide will be updated with relevant information to help players decide whether to trust the prisoner or not.

Hollow Knight: Silksong
9.7 /10
Released
September 4, 2025

item.title: Most Historically Accurate Medieval Games
item.description:
Medieval games are among the most popular, allowing players to escape the modern world for simpler times. Thankfully, after decades of the Middle Ages being depicted as drab and dirty in films, many video games have done the period justice, striving for historical accuracy and immersion.

Not only are the following games purely medieval, with no magic apart from charlatans, but they also pay attention to the details with lavish interiors in place of bare stone walls and colorful fabrics instead of leather. In these historically accurate medieval games , armor is useful, deflecting blows rather than being sliced through like butter. All of this and more is ideally combined to create realistic experiences of the Middle Ages, from which players can even learn about history.

5 Kingdom Come: Deliverance

The Original Medieval Masterpiece

Kingdom Come: Deliverance
RPG

Released
February 13, 2018
Developer(s)
Warhorse Studios
Platform(s)
PS4, Xbox One, PC, Switch
Powered by

For many years, Kingdom Come: Deliverance held the title of the most historically accurate medieval video game ever made, only recently being surpassed by Warhorse Studios' sequel. This open-world RPG sees players take on the role of a blacksmith's son, Henry, who has few skills and little experience of the world. In terms of accuracy, players are able to explore real castles and villages, some of which have one-to-one layouts.

Players will also notice that interiors are elaborately decorated, with the churches being a huge standout. Walking around the Sasau region, Henry will come across countless NPCs with their own lives, most of whom are wearing bright fabrics. In combat, he will face off against correctly armored men-at-arms, with players unable to beat more than a few of these at once, even after Henry has spent hours training.

4 Inkulinati

Medieval Manuscript Illustrations Brought To Life

Inkulinati
Turn-Based Strategy
8.0 /10

Released
February 22, 2024
Developer(s)
Yaza Games
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5
Powered by

Inkulinati might not be what most people envisage when the term 'historically accurate' is thrown around. For starters, dogs and hares don't wield bows or spears, and snails don't eat knights. However, if screenshots of the game were shown to a medieval person wealthy enough to own an illuminated manuscript, they would recognize the art style and be unfazed by the dancing skeletons.

The strategy game captures a side of the medieval world that is usually reserved for menus and UI by bringing the marginalia of manuscripts to life. In Inkulinati , Players take on the role of Masters such as Dante or St. Francis and use their Ink resource to draw units to fight for their side. These units include trumpet-playing donkeys and cats dressed as bishops, all taken from real medieval art.

3 Crusader Kings 3

Take On The Role Of A Medieval Ruler

Crusader Kings 3
RPG
Grand Strategy
12
8.7 /10

Released
September 1, 2020
Developer(s)
Paradox Interactive
Platform(s)
PS5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC
Powered by

Crusader Kings 3 is a grand strategy game where players take control of any medieval ruler in the years 867, 1066, and 1178. Particularly, in the later dates for which there is more recorded history, most historical figures have the correct age, family, and borders, with some even having Personality Traits that match what is known about them.

While from there on out, alternative history is created by the player and AI rulers, this historically accurate backdrop and immersive events pave the way for a mostly realistic experience. Medieval scholars, warriors, and poets, such as Hildegard von Bingen, will even pop up in their respective time periods, and can be recruited to the player's court, perhaps becoming the royal chronicler. Despite being a strategy game, it is also an RPG and simulator, with characters able to marry, be excommunicated, and travel to tournaments.

2 Manor Lords

Build Realistic 14th Century Towns & Villages In Franconia

Manor Lords
Strategy
City Builder
8.8 /10

Released
April 26, 2024
Developer(s)
Slavic Magic
Platform(s)
PC, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Manor Lords is a medieval city-building game that sets itself apart by focusing on historical accuracy and immersion. For starters, it is based upon the Franconia region in the 14th century, grounding it in history with a researched aesthetic. A lack of a grid also means players can build their villages organically, building burgage plots around roads, fields, and the natural environment. These plots also have extensions at the back to grow vegetables, raise chickens, or for certain trades.

Each building is constructed in real time by the available villagers, each of whom plays their own part in the process. This starts with trees being felled, transported by an ox, chopped, and then carried to the building. Villagers also plow the fields and plant them in the correct seasons, with more hands needed during the harvest. Impressively, leaving a field fallow each year is recommended, as soil fertility is a real thing in Manor Lords . In game modes involving raids and war, players will have to weigh up the risk of losing valuable workers in battle, and each corpse must be buried.

1 Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2

The Most Accurate Depiction Of Medieval Life In Any Media

Kingdom Come: Deliverance II
RPG
Action-Adventure
Open-World
10 /10
68
9.1 /10

Released
February 4, 2025
Developer(s)
Warhorse Studios
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S, PC
Powered by

When it comes to historical accuracy and immersion, no game can hold a candle to Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 . Set in 1403 Bohemia, players continue as Henry, but this time in the area around Trosky Castle and on a second map featuring the city of Kuttenberg. Walking around Kuttenberg is an experience like no other in gaming, with priests delivering sermons, merchants calling their wares, and passers-by calling out to Henry based on his appearance.

KCD2's impressive graphics help sell the realism, but more importantly, the attention to detail and historical research is second to none, with townhouses being elaborately painted, fashionable hats from around Europe, and each NPC having their own role and schedule in medieval society. From a gameplay perspective, the open-world RPG features accurate combat where armor matters, only overcome by using the correct weapons, stances, and techniques. It even features early guns that were around at the time, but rarely depicted.
